comment.author: 26033330@N00
comment._content: Truly magnificent photography. The landscape looks terrific. Composition really is an artform.

comment.author: 39191857@N05
comment._content: There are lots of entries in local websites including "Finnvalley.ie and megalithic Ireland.  It appears that the area has been modernised taking away much of its charm and the setting.  Great old shot and nice to know the well still attracts pilgrims.

comment.author: 72163146@N08
comment._content: Lovely to see the well as it used to be. It is landscaped beyond recognition now. My people visit it on the 9th June, the feast of St Colmcille.

comment.author: 47290943@N03
comment._content: [http://www.flickr.com/photos/72163146@N08] That's lovely to hear, thank you! As you say, nowadays manicured within an inch of its life...
comment.authorname: National Library of Ireland on The Commons

comment.author: 22845855@N07
comment._content:
Hi I love this shot. I grew up in Co. Donegal and not too fR from there. I remember 
Visiting there with my late father and being fascinated by all the crutches and
All the bits and pieces left behind. 

Makes me wish I lived in Donegal now rather than a city.
